t: Numbers 24
Now*p when Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord*s to bless Israel, he did not resort to divination as at other times, but turned his face toward the wilderness.
When Balaam looked out and saw Israel encamped tribe by tribe, the Spirit of God came on him
and he spoke his message: “The*pn prophecy of Balaam son of Beor, the*ld prophecy of one whose eye sees clearly,
the*ln prophecy of one who hears the words of God, who*ld sees a vision from the Almighty, who*ld falls prostrate, and whose eyes are opened:
“How*pn beautiful are your tents, Jacob, your*ld dwelling places, Israel!
“Like*pn valleys they spread out, like*ld gardens beside a river, like*ln aloes planted by the Lord,*s like*ld cedars beside the waters.
Water*ln will flow from their buckets; their*ld seed will have abundant water. “Their*pn king will be greater than Agag; their*ld kingdom will be exalted.
“God*pn brought them out of Egypt; they*ld have the strength of a wild ox. They*ln devour hostile nations and*ld break their bones in pieces; with*ld their arrows they pierce them.
Like*ln a lion they crouch and lie down, like*ld a lioness—who dares to rouse them? “May*pn those who bless you be blessed and*ld those who curse you be cursed!”
Then*p Balak’s anger burned against Balaam. He struck his hands together and said to him, “I summoned you to curse my enemies, but you have blessed them these three times.
Now leave at once and go home! I said I would reward you handsomely, but the Lord*s has kept you from being rewarded.”
Balaam*p answered Balak, “Did I not tell the messengers you sent me,
‘Even if Balak gave me all the silver and gold in his palace, I could not do anything of my own accord, good or bad, to go beyond the command of the Lord*s —and I must say only what the Lord*s says’?
Now I am going back to my people, but come, let me warn you of what this people will do to your people in days to come.”
Balaam’s Fourth Message
Then*p he spoke his message: “The*pn prophecy of Balaam son of Beor, the*ld prophecy of one whose eye sees clearly,
the*ln prophecy of one who hears the words of God, who*ld has knowledge from the Most High, who*ln sees a vision from the Almighty, who*ld falls prostrate, and whose eyes are opened:

“I*pn see him, but not now; I*ld behold him, but not near. A*ln star will come out of Jacob; a*ld scepter will rise out of Israel. He*ln will crush the foreheads of Moab, the*ld skulls of all the people of Sheth.
Edom*ln will be conquered; Seir,*ld his enemy, will be conquered, but*ld Israel will grow strong.
A*ln ruler will come out of Jacob and*ld destroy the survivors of the city.”
Balaam’s Fifth Message
Then*p Balaam saw Amalek and spoke his message: “Amalek*pn was first among the nations, but*ld their end will be utter destruction.”
Balaam’s Sixth Message
Then*p he saw the Kenites and spoke his message: “Your*pn dwelling place is secure, your*ld nest is set in a rock;
yet*ln you Kenites will be destroyed when*ld Ashur takes you captive.”
Balaam’s Seventh Message
Then*p he spoke his message: “Alas!*pn Who can live when God does this?
Ships*ld will come from the shores of Cyprus; they*ln will subdue Ashur and Eber, but*ld they too will come to ruin.”
Then*p Balaam got up and returned home, and Balak went his own way.
